noun.description: An ornamental cloth covering hung or held up over something, especially a throne or bed.
examples: a romantic four-poster bed complete with drapes and a canopy
a full moon and a canopy of stars

verb.description: Cover or provide with a canopy.
examples: the river was canopied by overhanging trees

origin: Late Middle English: from medieval Latin canopeum ceremonial canopy, alteration of Latin conopeum mosquito net over a bed, from Greek kōnōpeion couch with mosquito curtains, from kōnōps mosquito.
